page.title: 19Education 30 years ago
page.content: {Studham School in the late 1940's and {early 1950's. The Old School and School House were situated just past the present school gates at the bottom of the hill to the right.The headmistress was a lady called Miss Stallworthy, who still lives in the village.She was assisted by a lady called Miss Hughes. The Old School House was divided in two by a large folding screen with approximately one third of the building being used as an infant class taken by Miss Hughes. She used to cycle every day from Gaddesden Row on a cycle that looked about 50 years old.If you were naughty in her class she would rap your knuckles with a ruler edge_wise on. At the age of 7 you moved into the big class taken by Miss Stallworthy. The school was heated by an old iron coke stove.cont
